item.title: Report E-2024120045
item.description:
Report E-2024120045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 6-gallon poly drums for waste and recovery. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120058
item.description:
Report E-2024120058

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-09
  • City: S CHICAGO HTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0254 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCH. It was reported that they found a 2-ounces release of “Printer Ink” UN1210 from a 275-gallon Metal Tote with a loose lid. The release impacted the trailer floor, and the tote. BCH wiped down the tote and secured the lid of the metal tote. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and felt comfortable with terminal personnel cleaning the release with PPE available on-site. Terminal place impacted product, oil dry and rags into (1) 10-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report I-2024120007
item.description:
Report I-2024120007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T00:59:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: Hillsdale
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The PVS Minibulk driver arrived on-site at Tyson Foods, checked in, and had his bill of Iading signed. The customer double checked the tank levels and told the driver he was fine to make the slotted amount on material for delivery. The tank was inside a building and the driver hooked up to the tank and the on-site representative for Tyson foods was in charge of watching the tank levels as the diver stayed with the truck. Suddenly the on-site representative came out yelling for the driver to stop the offload. The tank had overflowed by 20-30 gallons with all of the material going into containment.

item.title: Report E-2024120002
item.description:
Report E-2024120002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1811 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XEJ. It was reported that approximately 20 gallons of Americo AMB-5147 released from a 270-gallon plastic tote due to improper loading by XEJ. The tote was punctured by the side of the trailer. The release impacted trailer #3117704 at dock door 38. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 75-gallons of UN3264 Americo AMB-5147 product released to a 12’ x 8.5’ area of the trailer floor due to impacted by sharp protruding object within the trailer. Contractors neutralized area with sodium bicarbonate and transferred material to new tote. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024120001
item.description:
Report E-2024120001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-01
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0522 ET, BCH notified ERTS of a cargo release inside trailer #3115104. It was reported 5-gallon of Gray Suede paint released from 8 5-gallon metal cans. The cargo was reported to be crushed during transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined terminal personnel can clean the release with PPE on site. The caller reported it will be absorbed with oil dri and placed into an 85-gallon metal drum.
